conditions.short_description: Wind slabs could be present high in mountains in most parts of the country, especially in the western and northern parts. Snow should gain strength in mild and dry weather this week.
conditions.full_description: Wind slabs could be present high in mountains in most parts of the country, especially in the western and northern parts. Snow should gain strength in mild and dry weather this week.

area_forecast.forecast: Snow has settled and gained strength in warm weather.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: Small natural slab avalanches fell last week in NW-facing gullies in Bláfjöll.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Snow was added in early March in southerly winds and snow showers. Thin wind slabs formed on north-facing slopes. They have settled and subsided in warm weather, snow is now widely isothermal. Beneath is old hardpacked snow. Continuing dry and mild weather is expected in the coming days, so the snow should continue to settle and strengthen over time.
area_forecast.weather: Þurrt. NV átt, yfirleitt fremur hæg. Dægursveiflur í hita, yfir frostmarki á daginn en frystir um tíma til fjalla á nóttunni.

area_forecast.forecast: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Sunday and is now generally isothermal. Wind slabs on top of old crust should continue to strengthen during the next days.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: Several loose avalanches fell in Ytri-Kirkjubólshlíð in Skutulsfjörður on Monday 10.3. Small loose avalanches also released in the area last week, in sunshine.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Snow added in the beginning of March and drifted in variable winds. Wind slabs formed in various aspects. Before, there was rather little snow in the area, with old hardpacked snow in mountains. Since Sunday, temperatures have been above freezing and snow has subsided. Several avalanches have fallen in the area in the warm weather. Dry and mild weather is expected in the coming days, so the snow should continue to settle and strengthen over time. Small avalanches may release in sunshine.
area_forecast.weather: Þurrt fram á föstudag. SV átt, allhvöss um tíma. Dægursveiflur í hita, yfirleitt yfir frostmarki á daginn en frystir til fjalla á nóttunni. Dálítil væta á föstudag.

area_forecast.forecast: Warm and sunny weather but blowing snow in S wind on Monday. Small sluffs have released in S-SE facing aspected due to the sun.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: A small slab avalanche released in Skeggjabrekkudalur in Ólafsfjörður 10.3. Small sluffs have released in S-SE facing aspects widely in the forecast area. An avalanche released in Krossafjall on March 4th.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Some softer snow ontop of firn in high elevations after SW wind on Monday. Sunny and warm weaterh in the last days and small wet avalanche activity in the area. Cornice collapse or small sluffs could release where the sun gets to shine and or because of warming weather.
area_forecast.weather: Suðlæg eða breytilegar áttir næstu daga og hlýtt í veðri, talsverð dægursveifla í hita. Þurrt að mestu næstu daga.

area_forecast.forecast: Little or no snow is at low elevations and hard packed snow is in the mountains. Some slabs might persist in places.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Little or no snow is at low elevations and hard packed snow is in the mountains. Small slabs could persist in places in high elevations.
area_forecast.weather: Breytileg átt og að mestu þurrt. Talsverð dægursveifla, kólnar lítillega á fimmtudag og svo aftur hlýnandi.

weather_forecast.forecast: Mostly dry until next weekend. Temperatures mostly above freezing, some freezing in mountains at night.
